Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The process steps are: CR, DV, FC, CA, AP, P, N, CL. But there are some branches where, for example, after DV if documents are incomplete, theres a Re-Document Submission (RDS) before proceeding. Similarly, if FC detects fraud, theres an In-depth Investigation (II) which might loop back.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: After DV, if documents are incomplete, the process must go through RDS, then back to DV with new documents. So the path would be DV RDS DV FC. So transitions from DV to RDS, then RDS to DV again, then DV to FC.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: After RDS, the process should re-submit documents, so perhaps after RDS, the process goes back to DV. Or after RDS, proceed to FC again? After RDS, the process goes back to DV to re-submit documents. Or maybe after RDS, the process can proceed to FC directly.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - NE
Text: DV can go to FC or RDS. Then, if it goes to RDS, then the next step is FC. So the path is DV RDS FC. So transitions: DV RDS (transition 4) RDS FC (transition 5).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Places: Start: initial place with a token. CR: after Claim Registration. DV: Document Verification. FC: Fraud Check. RDS: Re-Document Submission. CA: Claim Assessment. AP: Approval. P: Payment. N: Notification. CL: Closure (final marking). II: In-depth Investigation.

Name: Validation - NE
Text: Starting from Start: Start CR DV FC CA AP P N CL. Thats a straight path. Alternatively, if there are loops like DV RDS FC, then the path would be Start CR DV RDS FC CA ... etc. Similarly, if FC II CA, then after FC, the process could go through II and CA instead of directly to CA.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: Each activity is a place with a token indicating that the process is in that state. So each step is a place with a token when the process is there.
